items.title: ‘Let’s trust consumers and stop this hot dog populism’: European politicians up in arms over vote to ban ‘steak’ and ‘meat’ reference to veggie protein
items.description: "A beef tomato doesn’t contain any beef ... Ladies’ fingers are not made of actual ladies’ fingers,” Austrian MEP Anna Stürgkh said.

items.title: Deutsche Bank and Jeffrey Epstein’s ghost
items.description: Given its long history of servicing high-risk clients, it is perhaps unsurprising that Deutsche Bank stepped in when Epstein was ditched by JPMorgan.

items.title: Trump jokes about a U.S.-Canada ‘merger’ as he reaches a trade deal and predicts a wave of southbound tourists
items.description: “The people of Canada, they will love us again,” Trump said despite relations hitting a historical low point. “Most of them still do ... I think they ...

items.title: Section 230 protected social media companies from legal responsibility for misinformation. AI chatbots could be about to change that.
items.description: Section 230's liability protections may not apply to AI chatbot outputs, legal experts say.

items.title: Stablecoin startup Coinflow raises $25 million to challenge Stripe
items.description: Pantera Capital led the round, with participation from Reciprocal Ventures, Coinbase Ventures, Jump Capital, and CMT Digital.
